citations.narrative:
Records of acquisition and disposition of animals were not available for review at time of inspection. Failure to maintain
these records impedes APHIS Officials' ability to trace animals being used in regulated activities and to ensure their
humane care and use. The facility must maintain records containing the required information in 2.75(b)(1)(i-vii) for animals
which fully and correctly disclose the number of animals held, owned, and acquired or disposed of including births and
deaths.
Correct from this date forward of 18 June 2024.

A developed contingency plan was not available for review at time of inspection. Contingency plans help prepare facilities
on how to provide humane handling of animals during emergencies. The licensee must develop a complete contingency
plan tailored to the facility and animals on hand. All employees must be trained on their roles and responsibilities within
this plan and the facility must maintain documentation of annual reviews of the plan.
Correct by 18 July 2024.

A female slender-horned gazelle named "Rosie" was found dead on 31 March 2024 and facility representatives indicate
cause of death was due to a predator. A bobcat was trapped on site later that day. The facility representatives state that
the animal's primary enclosure fencing is electrified in all sections and that a mesh skirt is affixed to the bottom to deter
digging by predators. Facility representatives indicate no other predation events have occurred since the death of Rosie.
The outdoor housing facility was not able to protect the animal from injury. The facility must be constructed of such
material and such strength as appropriate for the animals involved. The indoor and outdoor housing facilities shall be
structurally sound and shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury and to contain the animals.
Correct from this date forward of 18 June 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
